methodology.description: Describes the overall methodology used in the ALD process, including experimental approaches and kinetic Monte Carlo simulations based on DFT calculations.

source.description: Indicates whether the data comes from experimental results or simulations.

simulationMethodology.description: Type of simulation used, e.g., DFT (Density Functional Theory), MD (Molecular Dynamics), KMC (Kinetic Monte Carlo), BOMD (Born-Oppenheimer Molecular Dynamics), ReaxFF (Reactive Force Field).

surfaceInitialCondition.description: Initial surface condition of the substrate, e.g., hydroxylated SiO2 surfaces.

temperature.description: Operating temperature during the ALD process in Kelvin, affecting the growth rate and ligand persistence.

pressure.description: Operating pressure during the ALD process in Pascals.

partialPressure.description: Partial pressure of the precursor during deposition in Torr, primarily significant during the DEZ pulse.

AS-ALD.description: Indicates if the process is area-selective atomic layer deposition.

softwareUsed.description: Software used for CFD analysis, e.g., CFD-ACE+.

reactorGeometry.description: Description of the reactor geometry used in the simulation.

boundaryConditions.description: Description of boundary conditions applied in the simulation.

validation.description: Indicates if the simulation results were validated against experimental data.

transientConditions.description: Indicates if the simulation includes transient conditions reflecting real-time changes during the ALD process.

flowRate.description: Flow rate through the top inlet in sccm.

temperature.description: Temperature of the top inlet flow in Celsius.

flowRate.description: Flow rate through the side inlet in sccm, used for reactant and carrier gas.

temperature.description: Temperature of the side inlet flow in Celsius.

flowRate.description: Flow rate through the loading door inlet in sccm, used for purging the loading door area.

temperature.description: Temperature of the loading door inlet flow in Celsius.

clusterSizeEffects.description: Describes the effects of cluster size on the reaction energies and mechanisms.

temperatureEffects.description: Describes how the stability of adsorbed intermediates changes with temperature, affecting the desorption of adsorbed precursors.

surfaceOHGroupConcentration.description: Concentration of surface hydroxyl groups, which correlates with the growth-per-cycle (GPC) in the ALD process.

growthPerCycle.description: The growth-per-cycle (GPC) indicating the efficiency of the ALD process, correlated with the surface OH group concentration.

metalPrecursor.description: Metal precursor used in the ALD process, e.g., HfCl4.

oxygenPrecursor.description: Oxygen precursor used in the ALD process, e.g., water.

precursorInteraction.description: Details the interaction between precursors and surface sites.

TMA.description: Vapor pressure of TMA at a specific temperature.

H2O.description: Vapor pressure of H2O at a specific temperature.

description.description: General description of the reaction mechanisms in the ALD process.

detailedMechanism.description: Detailed step-by-step reaction mechanism as described in the research.

selfCleaningEffect.description: Describes the self-cleaning effect observed on oxidized Ge surfaces during ALD, leading to an intermixed Al2O3/GeOx layer.

intermixedLayerFormation.description: Details the formation of an intermixed Al2O3/GeOx layer and its effects on suppressing oxygen diffusion into Ge.

densificationMechanisms.description: Describes the densification mechanisms that occur during the deposition of HfO2, including the role of hydroxyl groups and dimerization processes.

spectroscopicEllipsometry.description: Indicates if in-situ spectroscopic ellipsometry is used for real-time monitoring during ALD.

XPS.description: Indicates if X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy is used for surface analysis post-ALD.

AFM.description: Indicates if atomic force microscopy is used to analyze surface morphology post-ALD.

MOSCap.description: Indicates if Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor Capacitor devices are fabricated to evaluate the electrical characteristics of dielectric/semiconductor interfaces.
